contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox person | name = Gisela | title = | spouse =[[Henry II, Duke of Bavaria]] | children =[[Henry II, Holy Roman Emperor]]<br/>[[Gisela of Hungary]]<br/>[[Bruno of Augsburg]]<br/>Brigitta<br/>Arnold | parents =King [[Conrad of Burgundy]]<br/>Adelaide of Bellay | relatives = [[Saint Emeric]] (grandson) }} '''Gisela of Burgundy''' (died on July 21, 1006) was the daughter of [[Conrad of Burgundy|Conrad the Peaceful]], [[King of Burgundy]] and Adelaide of Bellay, Conrad's second wife whom he probably married for love, as he had already produced an heir ([[Rudolph III of Burgundy|Rudolph III]]) by his first, more dynastic, marriage and was thus free to wed as he pleased. Gisela was a niece of the empress [[Adelaide of Italy|Adelaide]]. She married [[Henry II, Duke of Bavaria|Henry the Quarrelsome]], [[Duke of Bavaria]] some time before 972. Although he died young, they had many children who acquired suitable positions among the ruling classes of Europe. ==Notes== *Morby, John E.: ''The Wordsworth Handbook of Kings & Queens'' {{Persondata | name = Burgundy, Gisela of | alternative names = | short description = | date of birth = | place of birth = | date of death = 1006 | place of death = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Burgundy, Gisela Of}} [[Category:10th-century births]] [[Category:1006 deaths]] [[Category:Kingdom of Burgundy]] [[Category:French princesses]] [[Category:Medieval women]] [[Category:Burials at NiedermÃ¼nster Abbey, Regensburg]] [[Category:Elder House of Welf]] {{Women's-History-stub}}
